interviewer: That's interesting. Could you elaborate on how you applied machine learning techniques in your project with OpenCV for decoding resistors? What specific challenges did you face and how did you overcome them?
candidate: Sure. We mainly used two machine learning techniques. We used a convolutional neural network to detect the resistors in the image. And then we used some regular image processing techniques to identify the bands. And then we used a k-nearest-neighbor algorithm to identify the colors of the bands. And then we just calculated the resistances. A big challenge that we had though was with k-nearest-neighbors and the shift in lighting. So in different lighting scenarios, we ended up with situations where the colors were too shifted tint-wise based on the ambient lighting. And so the k-nearest-neighbor algorithm was incorrectly identifying color bands. We managed to overcome them though by just getting enough training data.
